Build 0531
Create a new plugin project using wizard.
Select Plugin with a view template.
Accept all defaults.
Finish
Run->Run As->Runtime workbench
Wait until it starts.
Run it again.
Following appears in console (unfriendly).
Question: Why don't we have a message dialog that tells the user that a runtime 
workbench is already running instead of dumping a stack trace to the console?

java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException: 
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: 
The platform metadata area is already in use by another platform instance, or 
there was a failure
in deleting the old lock file.  If no other platform instances are running, 
delete the 
lock file (C:\WINDOWS\Desktop\0531\eclipse\runtime-workspace\.metadata\.lock) 
and try starting the platform again.
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.createLockFile
(InternalPlatform.java:195)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.loaderStartup
(InternalPlatform.java:546)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.startup
(InternalBootLoader.java:873)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run
(InternalBootLoader.java:732)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:432)
	at EclipseRuntimeLauncher.main(EclipseRuntimeLauncher.java:24)
Exception in thread "main"

The message is only created as a log entry by Core. For a while, PDE had an 
elaborate mechanism whereby it kept track of running instances and prevented 
the user from launching the run-time instance on the same workspace twice. This 
mechanism was dependent on events from the launcher and was not robust enough. 
For example, if the run-time instance crashes or is otherwise unnaturally 
terminated, PDE is not notified. After that PDE would prevent users from 
launching the instance. We had to remove the support because the problems it 
created outweighted the problem it was trying to solve.
